meanings.definition: Having the form or nature of air
meanings.sent1: The balloon floated gracefully in the aeriform sky.
meanings.sent2: The fresh breeze felt aeriform against my face.
meanings.sent3: The aeriform clouds seemed to dance in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as aeriform as the wind, constantly changing.
meanings.sent5: The aeriform quality of his voice made it seem ethereal.

meanings.sent1: The aeriform substance evaporated quickly in the heat.
meanings.sent2: The chemist studied the aeriform properties of the liquid.
meanings.sent3: The aeriform gas escaped from the container with a hiss.
